oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RELATIVISTIC MEAN-FIELD DESCRIPTION OF THE EVEN-EVEN PROTON DRIP-LINE NUCLEI NEAR Z = 34
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHEIKH, JA
MAHARANA, JP
GAMBHIR, YK
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The ground state properties of the even-even Zn, Ge, Se, Kr, and Sr nuclei are studied in the vicinity of the proton drip line, in a relativistic mean field approach. The knowledge of the properties of these nuclei is crucial in understanding the passage of the r process in astrophysics. The obtained binding energies are shown to be consistent with the measured masses wherever available or otherwise with the mass table of Moller and Nix. The shape coexistence between prolate and oblate structures obtained for 70Kr and 72Kr isotopes is analyzed in detail.
